title: Arsenal pincha de local y sacude la Premier League; Liverpool y Luis DÃ­az sonrÃ­en
text: El Arsenal cerrÃ³ la jornada nÃºmero 19 de la Premier League 2023/2024 con derrota, y cayÃ³ 2-0 en condiciÃ³n de local en el Emirates Stadium ante el West Ham United, perdiendo asÃ­ la posibilidad de recuperar el liderato de la tabla de posiciones. Pese a que dominaron y tuvieron muchas ocasiones, los dirigidos por Mikel Arteta, en especial Saka, no supieron terminar las jugadas a la hora de definir y se vieron rÃ¡pidamente en desventaja. Al final, los visitantes sÃ­ aprovecharon las pocas oportunidades de gol que generaron y se quedaron con los 3 puntos.Cabe recordar que el Liverpool venciÃ³ 2-0 el martes pasado al Burnley y quedÃ³ como Ãºnico lÃ­der de la liga inglesa durante el tradicional â€˜Boxing Dayâ€™, en el que el Aston Villa tambiÃ©n perdiÃ³ 3-2 contra el Manchester United, que parece haber superado su crisis.Ante un gran marco en el estadio de Turf Moor, el equipo de JÃ¼rgen Klopp abriÃ³ el marcador con un ajustado disparo de Darwin NÃºÃ±ez desde la frontal a los 6 minutos, mientras que sobre el final del partido el colombiano Luis DÃ­az asistiÃ³ al portuguÃ©s Diogo Jota , quien asegurÃ³ la victoria.Resultados â€˜Boxing Dayâ€™ Martes Newcastle - Nottingham Forest 1-3.Bournemouth - Fulham 3-0.Sheffield United - Luton 2-3. author: @KSLA
title: Tank fire extinguished at CITGO after lightning strike
text:
Tank fire extinguished at CITGO after lightning strike
SULPHUR, La. (KPLC) - Emergency crews put out a tank fire this afternoon at CITGO.
The fire was burning at Cit-Con, often referred to as CLAW (CITGO Lubricant and Wax Plant).
Around 1:25 p.m., lightning struck a tank at CITGO Lake Charles Refinery and ignited a fire, CITGO said in a statement. Emergency crews responded immediately and worked to extinguish the fire for around three and a half hours.
Jared Maze, Calcasieuâ€™s Director of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness, said an oil/gas substance was burning and there is no offsite impact at this time.
â€œWe have the State Department of Environmental Quality monitoring, theyâ€™re not picking up any particulates at this time,â€ Maze said. â€œRight now thereâ€™s no impact to the residents in the surrounding area. They can go about their business, just stay tuned to local media.â€
Maze said DEQ will send out an alert to residentsâ€™ phones if any danger to the public arises.
CITGO said all regulatory agencies have been notified, and all personnel are accounted for.
â€œThe safety of our employees, community and environment remains our top priority and will guide our actions as we respond to this incident," CITGO said in a statement.
